title: King Records logo
content:
I'm sure this was originally created by hand, but wondered if something similar (or identical) might have been created in the interim. Working on a project to raise money for a King Records-related project in Cincinnati and would love to be able to make use of the actual logo font. Thank you.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131226024855im_/http:/typophile.com/files/King-Logo-sm_4847.jpg)
author: mau222

comments.content:
The logo lettering dates from the mid 1940s., vut is not identical to the modern logo.  
1946:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131226024855im_/http:/typophile.com/files/King1946_5039.jpg)
  
1948:  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131226024855im_/http:/typophile.com/files/King1948_4926.jpg)
  
Similar lettering was used for a sister label, Queen. Here is a 78 from 1947:  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131226024855im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Queen1947_6458.jpg)
  
This would have been sufficient for Nick Curtis to make a font, but IIRC he did not do this one.  
Perhaps someone else did?  
Don
